intro: Epilobium glaucum f. philippianum, commonly known as the Philippine willow herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the Onagraceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, typically in shades of pink to red, which bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, often shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural interest.
